Reason: The 'counter_cache_save_period' configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the frequency of saving keys in the counter cache, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. The configuration involves time-expensive operations related to I/O operations, where setting a lower value can increase the frequency of saves and potentially impact system performance. Additionally, setting a higher value may reduce the frequency of saves but could lead to data loss in case of system failure. Therefore, the configuration has a direct and substantial effect on system performance, making it performance-sensitive.
